name: bound
posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

dsense.name: bound
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: certain or extremely likely to happen
trans_examp.trans_cn: 肯定的；极有可能的；必然的；注定了的

example.eg: You're bound to forget people's names occasionally.
example.egtrans: 你肯定会偶尔忘记别人的名字。

example.eg: You're bound to feel nervous about your interview.
example.egtrans: 面试时你很可能会感到紧张。

example.eg: These two young musicians are bound for international success (= are certain to be successful).
example.egtrans: 这两位年轻的音乐家一定会蜚声国际。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to be seriously intending to do something

example.eg: They are bound and determined to build their own house someday.
example.egtrans: 他们坚信总有一天他们会盖起自己的房子。

example.eg: He's in the pub, I'll be bound.
example.egtrans: 我敢肯定他在酒吧。

dsense.name: bound
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: having a moral or legal duty to do something
trans_examp.trans_cn: 受束缚的，受约束的；（法律或道德上）有义务的

example.eg: The company is bound by a special agreement to involve the union in important decisions.
example.egtrans: 公司受一项特殊协定的约束，须请工会参与重大决策。

example.eg: She feels (duty)-bound to tell him everything.
example.egtrans: 她觉得自己有义务告诉他一切。

dsense.name: bound
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: tied with rope, cord, string, etc.

example.eg: We found the girl bound and gagged.
example.egtrans: 我们发现女孩被绑住了，嘴也堵上了。

trans_examp.trans_en: (of a book) having a cover made of paper, leather, or other material

example.eg: The book was bound in shiny green leather.
example.egtrans: 该书是用闪亮的绿皮面装帧的。

dsense.name: bound
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 去…的；准备前往…的；开往…的

example.eg: She was on a plane bound for Moscow when she got sick.
example.egtrans: 她在前往莫斯科的飞机上突然生病了。

name: bound
posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: bound
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to move quickly with large jumping movements

dsense.name: bound
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to mark or form the limits of
trans_examp.trans_cn: 形成…的疆界；成为…的界线

example.eg: The town is bounded on one side by a river.
example.egtrans: 村庄的一边以一条河为界。

dsense.name: bound
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en:
past simple and past participle of
        
         bind

name: bound
posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: bound
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

example.eg: With one bound the dog was over the fence.
example.egtrans: 那条狗一下就跃过了篱笆。

dsense.name: bound
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: （法律或社会的）界限；限制；限定区域

example.eg: The committee felt that newspaper coverage of the murder went beyond reasonable bounds.
example.egtrans: 委员会觉得报纸对谋杀案的报道超出了正常的范围。

example.eg: What you did was beyond/outside the bounds of acceptable behaviour.
example.egtrans: 你的所作所为令人无法接受。

example.eg: His desire for political power apparently knows no bounds (= seems to be unlimited).
example.egtrans: 他对政治权力的欲望显然没有止境。

name: -bound
posTip: A letter or group of letters added to the end of a word to make a new word.

dsense.name: -bound
dsense.posTip: A letter or group of letters added to the end of a word to make a new word.

example.eg: Northbound traffic is moving very slowly because of the accident.
example.egtrans: 由于交通事故，北去的车辆移动非常缓慢。

example.eg: The line did not close completely, but inbound and outbound trains (= trains which were arriving and leaving) had to share one of the two tracks near the station.
example.egtrans: 铁路线没有全部关闭，但进出站的火车只能使用车站附近两条轨道中的一条。

dsense.name: -bound
dsense.posTip: A letter or group of letters added to the end of a word to make a new word.

trans_examp.trans_en: (causing people to be) unable to leave a place because of an unwanted condition

example.eg: During his long illness he was completely housebound (= he could not leave the house).
example.egtrans: 久病期间，他只能一直呆在家里。

example.eg: She has been wheelchair-bound for several years.
example.egtrans: 她已经坐轮椅好几年了。

example.eg: The airport was completely fogbound (= covered by fog).
example.egtrans: 机场完全被大雾封住了。

dsense.name: -bound
dsense.posTip: A letter or group of letters added to the end of a word to make a new word.

trans_examp.trans_en: used to describe a book that is covered or held together in the stated way

example.eg: a leather-bound book
example.egtrans: 皮面书

example.eg: a spiral-bound notebook
example.egtrans: 螺旋钢丝装订的笔记本

trans_examp.trans_en: used to describe clothes or other objects that have edges covered in the stated way

example.eg: leather-bound cuffs
example.egtrans: 镶皮边的袖口
